Posted By: Dr.Pingas (11/1/2011 12:55:11 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Something to ponder: Why does he die (becomes a Spirit) before he becomes a Warrior?  
  
I think it would make more sense if he:  
1) Was born. (1/1)  
2) Grows up training and becomes a warrior. (2/2)  
3) Dies in battle, yet his fury (![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)) and duty (![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol)) keep him in the fight. (4/4)  
4) As he assists his living comrades, he earns their praise. Now, fueled by their worship, becomes an Avatar and takes flight. (8/8)
posts.html:
Something to ponder: Why does he die (becomes a Spirit) before he becomes a Warrior?

I think it would make more sense if he:
1) Was born. (1/1)
2) Grows up training and becomes a warrior. (2/2)
3) Dies in battle, yet his fury () and duty () keep him in the fight. (4/4)
4) As he assists his living comrades, he earns their praise. Now, fueled by their worship, becomes an Avatar and takes flight. (8/8)

Posted By: OmegaSerris (11/12/2011 11:57:22 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Think of the deck less as fire and lightning and more as "Nostalgic RDW deck with lots of iconic red cards that we slapped a flashy-sounding name onto" and it makes more sense. =p Figure is one of the iconic red cards - despite not being all that old - and when they designed this deck they wanted to include a lot of the iconic cards.
posts.html:
